Posts.Content: Nov 16, 2013 02:07PM naturegirl2 wrote: hi desi, thanks for your input. Your calcium level should be checked each time before an Xgeva shot. Hmmm, yes, check that out. If your calcium is too low, they cannot give you the Xgeva shot. Well y'all, good news! I had my 7th monthly Xgeva shot yesterday. My oncol. has changed the time frame for me in getting Xgeva to every other month! Yay!!! And I will continue to see my oncol. every other month as well. I asked him why cutting back Xgeva to every other month and he said since I am stable and everything looks good at this point, getting an Xgeva shot every month may bring on complications I do not need.
Posts.Title: Xgeva users - step up naturegirl2 Suesbooby2

Posts.Content: Feb 6, 2015 11:13AM naturegirl2 wrote: Roberta2, it is said not to have invasive surgery with regard to your teeth while you are on Xgeva shots due to osteonecrosis.  This has happened to me and I didn't have invasive surgery but rather 2 root canals, one root canal one month(my oncologist said it would be okay) after a shot of xgeva, and the other root canal two months after.  Everyone is different though.  I took a total of 10 xgeva shots over the period of one year.  At that time I was on Afinitor/Aromosin, I began having mouth sores.  My oncol. thinks a mouth sore got infected, and xgeva kicked in and did it's dirty work.  I had a 'dying bone in the roof of my mouth, under my torus, it was horrible. It had to be removed.   Soooo, I would not have any invasive surgery(teeth pulling) if I were you since you have taken Xgeva shots for 15 months.  Take it from me, you don't want to go thru what I did.
Posts.Title: Xgeva users - step up naturegirl2 Suesbooby2

Posts.Content: Jan 27, 2015 11:21AM naturegirl2 wrote: Sue, I am so sorry to read of your hip fracture, and, due to taking Xgeva shots.   I know you will have surgery today and wish you a complete and speedy recovery.  You did right in pursuing your problem in going to an orthopedic doctor as you would still be suffering and not knowing until YOU took action.   I have had a similar problem due to taking Xgeva shots.  I took a total of 10 Xgeva shots over a period from May, 2013 thru May, 2014.  I began with pain in roof of my mouth in Oct. 2013, as y'all can look back in this thread to see where I was complaining.  I suffered over 1 year before I, yes, I, resolved the problem with the help of my oral surgeon.  I was taking Afinitor/Armomisin combo and had started taking the combo March of 2014.  As it turned out, after several trips to my dentist, and several trips to an oral surgeon, over a period of many months, I was diagnosed with osteonecrosis of the roof of my mouth (torus pallitus (ph). I suffered with this pain for one year prior to learning what it was. By November of 2014, I began blowing my nose with a horrific smell coming out.  After that, with blood/mucus.  When I saw my oncologist, he said I had a sinus infection.  WRONG.  He put me on a regimen of antibiotics and after one week, it did not improve.  I then went to my oral surgeon once again. Turns out, my oral surgeon had to remove part of rotting, dead bone in the roof of my mouth under my torus pallatisis (ph).  He said had I waited a little longer, I would have had an infection of my entire face which would also have gone to my brain.  He said he was 99.9 percent sure it was due to taking Xgeva shots.  What a terrible experience.  So heads up y'all.  And, no more Xgeva shots for me.
Posts.Title: Xgeva users - step up naturegirl2 Suesbooby2

Posts.Content: Feb 17, 2014 12:55PM naturegirl2 wrote: Thanks everyone for your responses.  It seems most that have posted are having minimal, if any, SE's from Xgeva shots but possibly some teeth problems.  I've had minimal SE's as well but I've only rec'd 8 Xgeva shots thus far.  With regard to my dental problems, I opted not to have the root canal and asked the dentist to prescribe a round of antibiotics instead with his miracle mouth wash.  Not sure if it was the antibiotics or his miracle mouth wash that has relieved the roof pain or not, but whatever it is, it has worked.  Keeping fingers crossed.   I took my last antibiotic yesterday, so far, so good.  We'll see.  Dentist did say the pain my start up in two weeks, but I'm hoping for a positive effect instead.  Tips - I have my Xgeva shot in my stomach each time and I do try to drink plenty of spring water before I get the shot.  I haven't gotten the flu-like symptom so far.

Posts.Content: naturegirl2 wrote: I am a two time breast cancer survivor but have been put thru the ringer 2 years in a row with mammogram readings of my remaining breast.  I recently had my yearly mammo (Dec) and tech took mammos three separate times, then onto a table facing down for the 4th round of mammos.  The radiologist came in for the table mammo and said if he determines there are clustered microcalcifications that a biopsy would be in order.  After closer look (table mammo) he determined I would not need a biopsy at this time but that I need a mammogram in 6 months to see if a change has occurred since I had BC in left breast.  I have been thru BC twice, the later in 07'.  As a result, a mastecomy was performed.   I am fearing the microcalcifications may turn into cancer.  I've read microcalcifications are sometimes pre cancerous?  Input, opinions appreciated.  DX July 1991 IDCI ER/PR-stage 1(1.1 cm) DX Jan.2007 IDC Her-2/neg ER+Stage 1 Mastectomy left breast DX-Nov.2012 Stage IV-Mets ER+PR+ Neg-,sternum, lungs, 1 spot on 6th rib Hormonal Therapy 11/24/2012 Femara (letrozole) Hormonal Therapy 3/15/2014 Aromasin (exemestane) Targeted Therapy 3/15/2014 Afinitor (everolimus) Hormonal Therapy 2/2/2015 Faslodex (fulvestrant) Targeted Therapy 12/30/2015 Ibrance (palbociclib) Chemotherapy 8/29/2016 Xeloda (capecitabine) Dx IDC, Stage IV, metastasized to bone/lungs Hormonal Therapy Faslodex (fulvestrant) Targeted Therapy Ibrance (palbociclib) Log in to post a reply

Posts.Title: Had CAT scan with contrast yesterday, waiting for results, help naturegirl2 DC197

Posts.Content: naturegirl2 wrote: Well, it's been 15 months taking Letrozole and due to my cat scan results, as of today, my oncol. wants me to stop Letrozole and begin taking Aromasin/Exemestane along with Afinitor(a relatively new drug on market) due to several lesions/tumors that have grown in size close to sternum area  along with multiple bilateral pulmonary nodules with index lesion measuring 8 mm. Bummer news but I do not have any spots/lesions in any other organs beside the lungs and sternum areas. Actually he said they were  lymph nodes that were affected behind the sternum area.  I do have a left adrenal nodule that is stable measuring 1.3 cm.  My cancer antigen levels went from 50 to 56.7.  So here we go.  Anyone taking this combination Aromasin/Afinitor?  Also, my oncol said Afinitor is extremely expensive and I need approval from my insurance and to see what they will cover. Posts.Content: Jun 29, 2016 09:26AM naturegirl2 wrote: Hi all, Looks like I'm joining liver mets thread now. I had one small spot on my last cat scan two months ago. I recently had another cat scan (few days ago) due to cancer antigen numbers elevating each month for the past three months, the last month showed really high. Anyways, my liver is normal in size and the blood work info on my liver looks good, but, I have multiple lesions that have increased in size and number and smaller nodules that have developed from prior cat scan. My oncol put me on Megace two weeks ago but had 'the talk' with me Friday about chemo down the line but he didn't know when. He did say there were many options, that some chemos are by pill, others IV, and with some, one wouldn't loose their hair.
Posts.Title: How are people with liver mets doing? blondie1 JFL

Posts.Content: Jul 3, 2016 09:39AM naturegirl2 wrote: zarovka, thanks for the information. I just pulled up & read Dr. Weil's anti-inflammatory diet. I'm glad to hear things are improving for you on your supplement and herbal regimen. I had been taking three 500 mil. high potency vitamin Cs daily but decided to cut back to two and rather than take the two together, take one in the morning and the other in the evening.I also have nodules etc. in my lungs so I thought the Vit C would help that. I was also taking Calcium/vit D vitamins for which I am going to cut back on as well. I want to try to protect my liver and if it has to absorb the Megace(is what my oncol has me on at this time) then that is what my liver has to contend with. Luckily, I do not take pain relievers daily, but every now and then, I take an ibuprofen(400 mil) but I think that may have to change as well. Will talk to my oncol. on that. Yes, I want to revamp what I'm putting in my mouth, both in supplements and in food with the idea of helping my liver. Now I did read recently that cappage and broccoli can be hard on the liver. and, not to drink caffeine or soft drinks and of course stay away from alcohol. I may look into the milk thistle thing, is it a liquid? I'll ask my oncol. as well about that. Thanks zarovka JFL, thanks for your information as well. I too used to take a multi-vit but quit that many years ago. Yes, one has to think twice and now consider their liver before she swallows food and/or vitimins. Thanks ShetlandPony on your input too. I incorporated a baby aspirin in my regimen daily as the Megace, or a potential side effect in taking Megace is blood clotting. I asked my oncol. first and he said he thought that was a good idea for me. MsTee, thanks for your input. That is great the mets are not showing on your scans due to a trial you were on! Guess you are having lots of pain since you use fentanyl patch? Others, please join in and tell us what you eat and what you stay away from since you have liver mets, as well as supplements, taking or discontinuing use. Thanks everyone!

Posts.Content: Jun 30, 2016 09:35AM - edited Jun 30, 2016 09:40AM by naturegirl2 Thanks GatorGal! I'm glad you are feeling better. I haven't heard of Ixempra before and, in combination with Megace but hope it does the trick for you for a long, long, time. As you know, that is what I am now on as of three weeks ago(Megace only), prior to this last cat scan due to my oncol. going on vacation, He did the cart before the horse thing, as he wanted me on something since he dismissed Ibrance/Letrozole three weeks ago and scheduled the cat scans after I began taking Megace. It is some kind of shock to say the least with this liver diagnosis. Last cat scan was two months ago, the day before my mom passed on, and the news was not good, but, nothing near this bad news on the latest cat scan. I am scared to death with many lesions and small new nodules in my liver. I also have additional lesions on left 2nd and 4th ribs, vertebral bodies T5, T12,L2,L3, and the right iliac bone. I'm so disgusted. Hi babs! Thanks for the warm welcome! Sorry the clinical trial did not work for you but Xeloda sounds like it really is doing well for you. My oncol. did not mention which chemo drug next, but I have a hunch it will be Xeloda. I made it loud and clear to him I did not want to be on anything for which I would loose my hair. Sorry y'all, I do draw the line somewhere. No one knows about my stage 4 diagnosis and that would certainly be a dead giveaway, hair loss, and besides, I don't want to loose my hair. It's enough I lost one breast back in 2007 and could not have reconstruction due to whole radiation I received back in 1991. Thanks holinone. Hi artist, we meet again! Yes, a terrible gut blow, I just don't think I'll be receiving any more 'good' cat scans as I feel the cancer will go from here to there each time from now on. I probably have it in my brain as well and I will NOT have an MRI for that, went thru that once before and cannot tolerate that. It's just so depressing for me right now. Sorry I'm venting on everyone but I do really appreciate everyone's help. Just a real bummer. Is anyone following a certain diet with these liver mets? And I'm sure and hint of alcohol is out right? Anyone taking any particular supplements for bc related liver mets? Thanks everyone! One thing good is the cat scan said my liver is normal in size, and, according to the latest blood work, my liver blood work showed normal.

Hopefully, this may help. With me, my hair strands started soon after taking Letrozole but wasn't very much, actually, just recently the hair loss shown from my brush/andor comb has considerably increased, and I'm thinking from the combination of Letrozole and Xgeva shots that I started 6 months ago. Letrozole usesage(ph) began 11 months ago. Urrrrgh
